titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Selah Central School Scrapbook 1926
titlestmt.author: Finding aid prepared by Dieter C. Ullrich

publicationstmt.publisher: Central Washington University Archives and Special Collections

profiledesc.creation: Finding aid encoded by Talea Anderson 2012
profiledesc.descrules: Finding aid based on DACS ( Describing Archives: A Content Standard).

repository.corpname: Central Washington University, Archives and Special Collections

did.abstract: Created in 1926 by the pupils of the 6th grade class at Central School of Selah, Washington, this scrapbook contains photographs, dried plant life, and other unique items of Selah Valley in Washington state.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: This scrapbook was created by Central School of Selah, Washington, for the students of Lincoln School, Columbia University, in New York City. Amanda Hebeler of the Washington State Normal School at Ellensburg supervised and assisted in the planning and organization of the project. The scrapbook was returned to the Central School in Selah along with letters from Lincoln School teachers and students. The scrapbook was ultimately procured by the Extension Service at Washington State Normal School.

scopecontent.p: Included in this scrapbook are photographs of the teachers and students of Central School, Selah, WA; postcards of the fruit farms of Selah valley; and miscellaneous pictures of the region. Amongst the letters and photographs in the scrapbook is a letter from the prominent banker David Rockefeller, who was ten years old when the scrapbook was created.

odd.p: Central Washington University began as the Washington State Normal School in 1891. In 1937, the school was rechristened the Central Washington College of Education. In 1961, the school became Central Washington State College and, finally, in 1977, Central Washington University.

accessrestrict.p: Open to the public for educational research

prefercite.p: [Name of document or photograph number]. RG031-05-56, Selah Central School Scrapbook. Archives and Special Collections, Brooks Library, Central Washington University.
